question: Mike found sixty-two seashells on the beach, he gave Tom some of his seashells. He has thirteen seashell left. How many seashells did he give to Tom ?
response:
Mike found sixty-two seashells on the beach. He gave some of his seashells to Tom, so the number of seashells he has left is thirteen. To find out how many seashells he gave to Tom, we can subtract the number of seashells he has left from the total number of seashells he found.

62 - 13 = 49

The answer is 49.
